data.title: PIN TALES: Fashion flows with Asbaty's game
data.meta_description: VICKI PREVOSTPin Tales \n The day before she won last week's QubicaAMF World Cup in Venezuela, USBC Youth Spokesperson Diandra Asbaty proved she's more than a great athlete. She's also an entrepreneurâ€¦
data.text:
VICKI PREVOSTPin Tales

The day before she won last week's QubicaAMF World Cup in Venezuela, USBC Youth Spokesperson Diandra Asbaty proved she's more than a great athlete. She's also an entrepreneur with vision.

Asbaty is the chief executive officer and co-founder of Kaizen by diandra, LLC, the new fashion sports apparel company whose first line of designer athletic wear, The Bogata Collection, was released before her own success on the lanes.

"More than simply a hip, unique spin on athletic apparel, the Kaizen by diandra brand is a phiosophy," Asbaty said. "Translated from Japanese, Kaizen means and signifies continual improvement or change. Kaizen by diadra strives to incorporate the evolving needs of athletes with personal expression and style."

Saying she plans to market the new firm's designs to bowlers and other athletes worldwide, The Bogota Collection is the first of many collections not simply named after unique cities, but collections that seek to capture the city's essence.

"Bowling has provided me the opportunity and honor of traveling," Asbaty said, "doing what I love. It is only natural that my passion for unique people and places would be infused into this designer clothing line."

The Bogota Collection features cotton-dominant women's and men's designs retailing for $34.95 each. To view the line and learn more, visit kaizenbydiandra.com

sad news

Lori Walker, 45, of New Bedford, a bowler in a couple of leagues at Wonder Bowl, died unexpectedly on Nov. 9. Her always-smiling face and ready laughter will be missed by her many bowling friends.

Donations may be made in her name to the Matty Oliveira Memorial Fund, 17 Holiday Dr., Fairhaven, MA 02719.

In , bowlers at Bowlmor Lanes are grieving the loss of one of their bowlers. Dartmouth's Richard Medeiros died Nov. 10 after a brief illness.

upcoming events

Holiday Lanes in Westport will have a Thanksgiving No-Tap Doubles Tournament at 730 p.m. Thursday. Entry fee is $30 per doubles team. For information, call the lanes at (508) 674-2224.
